CharEncoding Class Reference

Class used for converting strings between different character encodings. More...

#include <CharEncoding.h>

    Character encoding type this instace is used for converting from.
  • CharEncodingType::charEncodingType m_toType
    Character encoding type this instace is used for converting to.
  • bool m_initedOK
    This one is true if the character encoding object was inited OK and by that can be used for converting characters.
  • bool m_dieOnError
    If an error is encountered and this one is set to true, the program is aborted with an exitcode.

Detailed Description

Class used for converting strings between different character encodings.

Definition at line 29 of file CharEncoding.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CharEncoding::CharEncoding (  CharEncodingType::charEncodingType  fromType,
CharEncodingType::charEncodingType  toType,
bool  dieOnError = false
) 
 

Constructor.

Inits iconv, which is used internally by this class.

Parameters:
fromType The character encoding this CharEncoding object will be used for converting from.
toType The characer encoding this CharEncoding object will be used for converting to.
dieOnError When setting this one to true, the program is aborted if an error is encountered.

CharEncoding::~CharEncoding (   ) 
 

Closes the handle to the iconv stuff.

Member Function Documentation

bool CharEncoding::convert (  const MC2String &  src,
MC2String &  dst
)  const
 

Converts the string src from the fromType encoding type of this encoding object to the to type of this encoding object.

The result is stored in dst.

Parameters:
src The string to convert. Must be in the encoding system fromType of this encoding object.
dst The converted result is stored here in the encoding of the toType of this encoding object.
Returns:
Returns true if the conversion could be carried out. Otherwise false.

CharEncodingType::charEncodingType CharEncoding::encStringToEncType (  const MC2String &  encodingStr  )  [static]
 

Gives the character encoding type used in mc2 for a string used with iconv.

Parameters:
encodingStr String that can be interpreted as a character encoding by iconv. Make sure that it is one of the strings stored in CharEncoding::m_encTypeToEncString.
Returns:
The character encoding type used in mc2 corresponding to the iconv character encoding string identifier. Returns CharEncodingType::invalidEncodingType if no match was found.

MC2String CharEncoding::encTypeToEncString (  CharEncodingType::charEncodingType  encodingType  )  [static]
 

Gives the string used with iconv for a character encoding type, used in mc2.

Parameters:
encodingType An encoding type used in mc2.
@ return The string used by iconv to identify the character encoding corresponding to encodingType. Returns an empty MC2String if no match was found.

bool CharEncoding::foldToIso8859_1 (  const MC2String &  src,
MC2String &  dst
)  const [private]
 

Takes any characters not beeing in the ISO-8859-1 set and replace them with one of the characters in ISO-8859-1 or removes it if there is no good replacement character in ISO-8859-1.

Parameters:
src The string to fold. Must be in the encoding system fromType of this encoding object.
dst The folded result is stored here. It may include less letters than the src string. The result is always encoded as ISO-8859-1, i.e. if the in data is in another charecter encoding it is both converted and folded to iso-8859-1.
Returns:
Returns true if everything went well, otherwise false.

vector<MC2String> CharEncoding::getAllChEncStrings (   )  [static]
 

Returns strings representing all character encoding types supported.

Returns:
Returns strings representing all character encoding types supported.

CharEncodingType::charEncodingType CharEncoding::getFromType (   )  const
 

Returns:
Returns the char encoding type converted from by this char encoder.

MC2String CharEncoding::getFromTypeStr (   )  const
 

Use for printing debug info about this character encoding object.

CharEncodingType::charEncodingType CharEncoding::getMC2CharEncoding (   )  [static]
 

Returns the char encoding used internally in the server.

This depends on how the server was compiled.

$return The characer encodign used internally in the server.

CharEncodingType::charEncodingType CharEncoding::getToType (   )  const
 

Returns:
Returns the char encoding type converted to by this char encoder.

MC2String CharEncoding::getToTypeStr (   )  const
 

Use for printing debug info about this character encoding object.

bool CharEncoding::iconvConvert (  const MC2String &  src,
MC2String &  dst
)  const [private]
 

The main internal method for converting strings.

Converts the string src from m_fromType to m_iconvToType. The result is stored in dst.

Parameters:
src The string to convert. Must be in the encoding system m_fromType of this encoding object.
dst The converted result is stored here in the encoding of the m_iconvToType of this encoding object.
Returns:
Returns true if the conversion went well. Otherwise false.

bool CharEncoding::initedOK (   )  const [inline]
 

Tells whether this conversion object can be used for converting character.

Returns false otherwise.

Returns:
Returns false if this conversion object not can be used for converting characters, otherwise true.

Returns:
The iso-8859-1 character.

Definition at line 245 of file CharEncoding.h.

const char* CharEncoding::m_iconvEnodingTypeString[] [static, private]
 

Mapping table for converting the enciding type used by mc2 to the enocding type identifier strings used by iconv.

This table shall as far as it is possible store only unambigous encoding type identifier strings. E.g. UCS-2BE and UCS-2LE instead of only UCS-2.

Definition at line 213 of file CharEncoding.h.

CharEncodingType::charEncodingType CharEncoding::m_iconvToType [private]
 

Character encoding type iconv is inited with when setting m_iconvDesc.

Only different from m_toType if m_toType is iso8859_1.

Definition at line 240 of file CharEncoding.h.

This one is true if the character encoding object was inited OK and by that can be used for converting characters.

unicodeToLatin1Table CharEncoding::m_unicodeToLatin1Table [static, private]
 

Maps unicode character codes to iso-8859-1 character codes.

Has to be sorted.
